ratings.comment: The whole class is built upon existing lecture videos. So the teaching is more related to self-learning. Office hours are available. However, the TA and professor never post solutions for homework/projects, nor will they give specific comments on grading. The workload is extremely high, especially if you don't have a reliable teammate.

This course they give you online video which is super easy which the hw and exams will be super hard. Really a tough grader for hw and provide no feedback. They will not give answer of homework, and no explanation, so you will never understand why you lose points. I decide not to go for 304 because the course is so poorly organized.

The workload is unbelievable, the exam is mission impossible. This course is basically online with a well organized short videos and quizzes, but the video is just basic. You need tons of self learning for the HW. Exam covers overwhelm amount of details that you learned by yourself in your HW, they didnt even publish HW solutions!

It shows that Covington is newer at teaching. You can tell he is an extremely intelligent person and at times forgets those hes teaching arent at his level. That being said, I felt like his class was challenging in a good way. I felt like I was forced to really learn the material and his notes contained many good examples.

Covington was extremely average in his teaching ability. He expects the students to know content on a deeper level even though he barely touched on it in lecture. Weekly homework assignments that are long and heavily weighted on your final grade. The discussion aspect of this course was an absolute joke and didnt help to deepen comprehension.

The worst instructor I ever met. The lecture content did not cover everything on the exam. I guess he would say: you did not learn hard enough. But the FACT is: there are many things that he "believed" we automatically understand, but no one knows it. Not even a PHD student.

Gives very limited and unhelpful feedback. The tests are incredibly difficult. He is a little short and can be rude. I would not recommend taking him as he doesn't even have a PhD or any quality teaching experience.
22 year old Prof. with out a PHD and can not teach for his life

This guy doesn't care about you and neither do the TAs. Make sure you go to lecture, and your greatest help outside of that is YouTube if you need things explained. Weekly homework assignments that are weighted heavily, between 15 and 20 percent. Exams are overly difficult and will cover the most advanced material presented in the course.

The most medicore professor to be at Madison. Pros are that the notes are honestly very clear and gives you an example for each problem every time. Cons is that the homework is graded and heavily weighted and the exams and purposely tricky questions and there isn't a lot of points on exams. Class is curved however.

Clear in lecture, and makes it easy to follow along by providing note outlines in advance. Tests are difficult. He was pretty fair in that he provided topic lists/practice exams, allowed a note sheet, and offered review sessions, but there were definitely tricks in his exams. One mistake can cost you several points. Study hard, and youll be fine.

This was the worst class I have ever taken. His notes are unclear and tests are impossible and there is not enough time to finish them. He is not qualified to teach and does not care to help you out either.

Really direct lectures and posts all notes online and filled in. Does clicker questions but they are ungraded, you just need to answer 60% of them to get your participation. No late exceptions on homework, which is to be turned in on paper before 4 pm and are super heavily weighted towards your grade. Kind of nitpicking on the grading as well.
Overall, he was an effective lecturer, he was always very clear and gave good examples of content. Exams were fairly difficult, but a full sheet of paper was always given for notes.

This professor was not good. His exams were so hard, not at all representative of the level of difficulty when practicing and learning in class. The structure of homework, lectures and discussion did not reflect the exams, further increasing difficulty. 2nd midterm avg was a 55%, and this is a intro level class...
